title: [Bug report] Advanced indexing with negative indices wrong
body_html:
Issue description

Advanced indexing with negative indices is wrong when combined with basic indexing.

Code example

import torch
v = torch.arange(2).view(2, 1)
print(v[:, [-1]])
# tensor([[ 1.],
#        [ 0.]])
print(v.numpy()[:, [-1]])
# [[0.]
#  [1.]]

System Info

PyTorch version: 0.4.0
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 8.0.61

OS: Ubuntu 16.04.2 LTS
GCC version: (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.4) 5.4.0 20160609
CMake version: version 3.5.1

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: Yes
CUDA runtime version: 8.0.61
GPU models and configuration: GPU 0: Tesla P100-PCIE-16GB
Nvidia driver version: 375.66
cuDNN version: Probably one of the following:
/usr/local/cuda-8.0/lib64/libcudnn.so.6.0.21
/usr/local/cuda-8.0/lib64/libcudnn_static.a

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip3] numpy (1.14.2)
[pip3] numpydoc (0.7.0)
[pip3] pytorch-fft (0.14)
[pip3] torch (0.3.1.post2)
[pip3] torchvision (0.2.0)
[conda] pytorch 0.4.0 py36_cuda8.0.61_cudnn7.1.2_1 pytorch
[conda] torchvision 0.2.1 py36_1 pytorch

body:
## Issue description

Advanced indexing with negative indices is wrong when combined with basic indexing.

## Code example

```
import torch
v = torch.arange(2).view(2, 1)
print(v[:, [-1]])
# tensor([[ 1.],
#        [ 0.]])
print(v.numpy()[:, [-1]])
# [[0.]
#  [1.]]
```

## System Info
PyTorch version: 0.4.0
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 8.0.61

OS: Ubuntu 16.04.2 LTS
GCC version: (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.4) 5.4.0 20160609
CMake version: version 3.5.1

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: Yes
CUDA runtime version: 8.0.61
GPU models and configuration: GPU 0: Tesla P100-PCIE-16GB
Nvidia driver version: 375.66
cuDNN version: Probably one of the following:
/usr/local/cuda-8.0/lib64/libcudnn.so.6.0.21
/usr/local/cuda-8.0/lib64/libcudnn_static.a

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip3] numpy (1.14.2)
[pip3] numpydoc (0.7.0)
[pip3] pytorch-fft (0.14)
[pip3] torch (0.3.1.post2)
[pip3] torchvision (0.2.0)
[conda] pytorch                   0.4.0           py36_cuda8.0.61_cudnn7.1.2_1    pytorch
